title: 9-year-old Lancaster boy shot in back by family member who was test-firing a handgun
content:
A 9-year-old Lancaster boy remains in critical condition Sunday night after he was shot in the back by a family member who was test-firing a handgun in the basement.
The boy had been standing in his front yard in the 600 block of E. Madison Street about 4:30 p.m. when he was hit by a stray bullet that broke through a door.
Someone at the home drove the boy to Lancaster General Hospital, but the boy was later transferred by medical workers to Hershey Medical Center, where he underwent surgery.
Police late Sunday were still interviewing the shooter and a dozen or so witnesses who were at the home for a family gathering on Easter.
The victim lives at the home where the shooting occurred and is related to the shooter, police said. Police did not release the names of the victim or suspect.
Police said they had no evidence the shooting "was an intentional act." Officers recovered the gun and accounted for everyone at the home.
Lancaster police were consulting with the District Attorney's office.
